confession.devil_appearance: had great claws on hands and feet
confession.seduction_context: when still young woman living with father, and distressed because he was under arrest in château of Taintrux as a witch

testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle leur feroit tant de mal et la mettroit sy bas qu'elle n'auroit du tout rien
qu'elle leur feroit tant de mal et la mettroit sy bas qu'elle n'auroit du tout rien

testimony.quarrel_subject: damage done by animals in field

testimony.threat_quote: avoit donné des malledictions a ses porcqs, mais qu'il s'en repentiroit
de leur faire tant de mal, qu'elle les rendroit sy pauvres qu'ils seroient contrainctz aller mendier leur pains

timeline.subject: Marguitte Lairain
timeline.details: procureur for abbot of Etival asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Marguitte Lairain
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews and racked, then after lunch put on rack again and given tortillons. Did not confess under torture. Marginal note 'c'est contre le droict et la praticque que la question a esté reiterée a la prevenue'

timeline.subject: Marguitte Lairain
timeline.details: Made voluntary confession, saying she had been thinking of her children and husband when she denied

timeline.subject: Marguitte Lairain
timeline.details: Change de Nancy asks that she repeat confessions freely before sentence is carried out

accomplices_named.name: Catherine femme Jean Demenge Villaume
accomplices_named.context: Recognized at sabbat since marriage, only one she could identify because of masks

accomplices_named.name: Didier Vincent
accomplices_named.context: Named as already executed witch seen at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: Marguitte femme Dionnel
accomplices_named.context: Named as already executed witch seen at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: wife of George Yolle
accomplices_named.context: Named as already executed witch seen at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: George le Clerc
accomplices_named.context: Named as already executed witch seen at sabbat

accomplices_named.name: George Cajel
accomplices_named.context: Named as already executed witch seen at sabbat

prior_accusations.context: 1602 confession at Taintrux - claimed to have seen her at sabbat and danced with her, mentioned she had recently been married in ban d'Etival

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Moullot
notable_quotes.french: Il commença de l'appeller sorciere, et luy dict que c'estoit elle qui tenoit ainsy sa femme en langueur, et sy elle ne luy donnoit guarison il la feroit prendre et brusler, ne scait quelle responce elle luy feit parce qu'il ne la peut entendre
notable_quotes.english: He began to call her witch, and told her that it was she who held his wife in languor, and if she did not give her healing he would have her taken and burned, does not know what response she made because he could not hear her
notable_quotes.context: Brother-in-law Nicolas Moullot confronting Marguitte after his wife fell ill following quarrel over shared fontaine

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine femme Nicolas Moullot
notable_quotes.french: sy elle desireroit bien de mourrir veu qu'elle avoit ung mary qu'estoit sy bon mesnagé, elle luy feit responce que sy c'estoit la volonté de Dieu, elle desireroit bien de demeurer quelque temps avec son mary, et qu'elle puisse nourrir son enfant qu'ilz avoient estez contrainct mettre a nourrice ad cause de sa grande maladie qu'elle ne le pouvoit allaicter
notable_quotes.english: if she would like to die seeing that she had a husband who was so good a manager, she replied that if it was God's will, she would like to remain some time with her husband, and that she could nurse her child whom they had been constrained to put to a wet nurse because of her great illness that she could not breastfeed
notable_quotes.context: Marguitte asking Catherine (sister-in-law) about dying, before offering her food to heal her

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine femme Nicolas Moullot
notable_quotes.french: estimoit qu'icelle prevenue luy avoit envoyé pour luy donner guarison
notable_quotes.english: believed that the accused had sent it to give her healing
notable_quotes.context: Catherine explaining why she ate the millasse Marguitte gave her

notable_quotes.speaker: Ydoulx Grand Didier
notable_quotes.french: avoit donné des malledictions a ses porcqs, mais qu'il s'en repentiroit
notable_quotes.english: had given curses to his pigs, but he would regret it
notable_quotes.context: Threat from Marguitte after quarrel over pigs damaging property

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Demenge Villaume
notable_quotes.french: de leur faire tant de mal, qu'elle les rendroit sy pauvres qu'ils seroient contrainctz aller mendier leur pains
notable_quotes.english: to do them so much harm, that she would make them so poor they would be constrained to go begging for their bread
notable_quotes.context: Threats to neighbors Jean Demenge Villaume and wife Catherine

notable_quotes.speaker: Catherine (neighbor, confessed witch)
notable_quotes.french: une sorciere des plus parfaictes... il n'y en avoit poinct de plus meschantes en toutte la trouppe
notable_quotes.english: one of the most perfect witches... there was none more wicked in all the troop
notable_quotes.context: Catherine's testimony after her own confession describing Marguitte at sabbat

notable_quotes.speaker: Persin (devil)
notable_quotes.french: ung beau jeune guerçon pour la marier, et l'assister en tout et partout en sorte qu'elle n'auroit aucune necessité
notable_quotes.english: a handsome young man to marry her, and assist her in all things everywhere so that she would have no need

relationships.evidence_text: Father Jean de Larrain had been executed as witch 7 years earlier
death of his first wife Jennon 7 years earlier

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell strangely ill, was in bed for a week, cried constantly, said Marguitte had bewitched her, called out one evening that she was on bed trying to strangle her
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: maid warned accused not to allow her horse to do more damage to field

harms_catalog.harm_description: became sick for 3 months, unable to stand properly, then recovered after Marguitte comforted wife

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: came to house and asked to see geese, forced her way to see them despite denials

harms_catalog.harm_description: became strangely ill, remained so for 3 months, all who visited said she was bewitched, could not eat, doctors could find no cure
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: major quarrel about shared fontaine, he called her witch

harms_catalog.harm_description: trouble with eye, became completely blind after 9 months, no cure despite all efforts
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute over damage done by animals of accused in field
heard her say girl would not serve her for two years on end, was often punishing her

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed, Marguitte took form of Catherine to implicate her
loss of baby she was carrying (miscarriage)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: failed to help with harvest as promised

harms_catalog.victim_name: wife of Demenge Drolbin of St Dié
harms_catalog.harm_description: fell ill same day, died 2 days later claiming she was bewitched
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: wife had quarrelled with her while carding wool at her house
numerous quarrels, threats to make them so poor they would beg for bread

harms_catalog.harm_description: stillborn, could not be baptised, mother herself was in danger
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: failure to help at harvest as promised, threats followed
angry with George Danoulzey who had obtained reparation after they alleged he had killed an ox
told her off for taking apples
harms_catalog.method_alleged: gave her an apple with black powder inside

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: she lent him three loads of straw and he only returned one

material_culture.context: plate of millasse given by Marguitte to heal Catherine femme Nicolas Moullot and Catherine femme Colas Moullot
shared fontaine that was subject of quarrel between Marguitte and Nicolas Moullot
powder given by Persin for harming men
powder given by Persin for harming animals
powder obtained from Persin to cure sister-in-law
Persin gave her money which turned to leaves
gave 2 annual black chickens to avoid sabbat attendance
Marguitte asked to see Didier Thiebault's geese
accused's pigs damaged garden of Ydoulx Grand Didier
Demenge Drolbin and wife came to card wool at Marguitte's house
lent Nicolas Wennequey three loads of straw, only returned one

spatial_references.context: residence of accused at time of trial
larger administrative area containing la Vacherie
where Marguitte was married according to George Danouzey's 1602 confession
where George Danouzey made confession in 1602, where father was held in château
place of execution, also home of Demenge Drolbin
location of witches named in confession
location of witch named in confession
where father was held under arrest as witch

economic_hardship_indicators: threat to make neighbors so poor they would beg for bread
disputes over shared resources (fontaine, straw loans)
concern over animal losses affecting economic status

change_de_nancy.modification_details: asked that she repeat confessions freely before sentence is carried out

hearsay_chains.content: advised Mengeon Moullat not to marry her because she was already reputed a witch
suspected her over great illness 4 years earlier, had given her plate of millasse to heal her
accused had killed Demenge le Tixerant
complained of great losses of animals, saying he did not know whether to blame his wife or Catherine
he and his wife had been to her house to card wool, wife quarrelled with her, fell ill same day and died 2 days later
threats from Marguitte after failure to help at harvest

emotional_state_notes: said she had been thinking of her children and husband when she denied
begged M. d'Etival to look after husband and children

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: repeatedly suggested Catherine was responsible for acts attributed to her, said Catherine was not worthy to be believed, claimed Catherine had done malefices to implicate her

third_parties.name: George Danouzey
third_parties.context: confessed witch from le Paire who accused Marguitte in 1602 confession at Taintrux, claiming to have seen her at sabbat

third_parties.name: Jean de Lairain
third_parties.context: father of accused, executed as witch 7 years before trial, had been denounced by George Danouzey in 1602

third_parties.name: Claudatte
third_parties.context: mother of accused, still alive at time of trial

third_parties.name: Georgeatte
third_parties.context: maid who fell ill after warning accused about horse damage, claimed Marguitte was trying to strangle her

third_parties.name: Mengeon Moullot
third_parties.context: husband of accused, married 7 years before at St Jean

third_parties.name: Jennon
third_parties.context: died 7 years earlier, Nicolas Moullot suspected Marguitte of causing death

third_parties.name: stepdaughter Marguitte
third_parties.context: aged about 18, died, general rumor in village that Marguitte killed her

third_parties.name: Demenge le Tixerant
third_parties.context: allegedly killed by Marguitte who took form of Catherine to implicate her

third_parties.name: Colas du Mont
third_parties.context: from Brehimont, advised Mengeon Moullat not to marry Marguitte because of her reputation

third_parties.name: Catherine femme Colas Moullot
third_parties.context: suffered great illness 4 years earlier, Marguitte gave her plate of millasse to heal her

third_parties.name: Demenge Drolbin
third_parties.context: from St Dié, he and his wife came to Marguitte's house to card wool

third_parties.name: wife of Demenge Drolbin
third_parties.context: quarrelled with Marguitte while carding wool, fell ill same day, died 2 days later claiming she was bewitched

third_parties.name: Collatte femme Demenge Pieron
third_parties.context: told Marguitte off for taking apples, Marguitte confessed to killing her with poisoned apple

third_parties.name: Persin
third_parties.context: devil who seduced Marguitte 12 years earlier, gave her powders, promised to find her a husband

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with detailed witness testimony, confession under and after torture, and full timeline. Significant case showing healing activities (giving millasse to cure), father executed as witch, and complex neighbor disputes. Marginal note indicates torture was repeated contrary to law and practice. Confession came voluntarily day after torture, not during torture itself.
